page.title: 14LIVING IN PILLEY
page.content: I came to Pilley in 1946 and in a short time knew everyone in the village.They were mostly families born and bred locally and very friendly. Some of the new people who have come into the village have little interest in local affairs and do not mix as freely as when we first came. Enough Council houses and private dwellings have been built during the past 40 years but small, cheap houses are needed for purchase by newlyweds so that they may stay in the village.I enjoy living here because it is quiet, a good distance from the main road, within easy reach of the town,the forest and the sea and people are friendly. What else can we ask for?
